```python
import sqlite3
conn = sqlite3.connect('mydatabase.db')
c = conn.cursor()

# Create a trigger that will log changes to the "users" table
c.execute('''CREATE TRIGGER log_changes AFTER INSERT OR UPDATE OR DELETE ON users
    BEGIN
        INSERT INTO log (timestamp, action, table, rowid)
            VALUES (DATETIME('now'), 'INSERT', 'users', NEW.rowid);
    END;''')

# Commit the changes and close the connection
conn.commit()
conn.close()
```
